revised_title: Investigating the Petrifying Qualities of Lough Neagh in Ireland
tldr: The author, William Molyneux, investigates the petrifying qualities of Lough Neagh in Ireland, focusing on the unique ability of the lake to turn holly wood into stone. He discusses various experiments, observations, and theories about the phenomenon, including the possible reasons for the varying strength of the petrifying quality in different parts of the lake.
